channel.title: Publication on Atsuya Watanabe's Personal Web-site
channel.description: Recent content in Publication on Atsuya Watanabe's Personal Web-site

item.description: New paper has been published on JALCOM! Fabrication of FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy nanoparticles by high-repetition-rate UV picosecond laser ablation in water Atsuya Watanabe, Tomoyuki Yatsuhashi Journal of Alloys and Compounds (in press). 10.1016/j.jallcom.2023.169896

New paper has been published on MST Microstructure and tensile strength of electrodeposited Fe-rich bcc FeCoNi medium-entropy alloys A. Watanabe, T. Yamamoto, R. Miyamoto, and Y. Takigawa Materials Science and Technology (in press). 10.1080/02670836.2023.2187973

HEA Internatinal Workship Prof. Yatsuhashi at Dept. Science, Osaka Metropolitan University presented the findings in our collaborative research. Fabrication of FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy by laser ablation in water using UV picosecond laser pulses Atsuya Watanabe, Tomoyuki Yatsuhashi． HEA International Workshop, Kyoto, 2023-02-14,15.

Oral presentetion I presented at the society for crystal orientation and crystal direction analysis technologies. Crystal orientation changes in electrodeposited nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy Atsuya Watanabe，Yorinobu Takigawa． Japan Intitute of metals and materials, 1st society for crystal orientation and crystal direction analysis technologies, 4, Atami, 2022-11-25.

Oral presentation at 2022 JIM Fall Meeting I presented at the session, “Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys (VIII)” in 2022 Japan Institute of Metals and Materials Fall Meeting. Deformation behavior of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloys at room temperature Atsuya Watanabe, Takahisa Yamamoto, Nozomi Ueyama, Yorinobu Takigawa. 2022 Japan Institute of Metals and Materials Fall Meeting, Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys (VIII), S1.20，Fukuoka.

Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022 Research findings of collaborative research have been presented in Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022. Laser ablation synthesis of FeCoNi medium entropy alloy colloidal solution by using high-repetition rate UV picosecond laser Tomoyuki Yatsuhashi, Atsuya Watanabe． Annual Meeting on Photochemistry 2022 ,1P26, Kyoto.

New paper has been published on SciRep Tensile strength of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy fabricated using electrodeposition A. Watanabe, T. Yamamoto, and Y. Takigawa Scientific Reports, 12, 12076 (2022). doi: 10.1038/s41598-022-16086-6 Tensile strength of nanocrystalline FeCoNi medium-entropy alloy fabricated using electrodeposition - Scientific Reports

I took an oral presentation at the spring meeting of the Japan Inst. Metals and Materials. A. Watanabe, T. Yamamoto, R. Miyamoto, Y. Takigawa. Electrodeposition of bcc FeCoNi medium entropy alloy with fine grains The spring meeting of the Japan Inst. Metals and Materials Materials Science and Technology in High-Entropy Alloys VII, S2.26, on-line.

A paper has been published as a first paper on RSURFI Reducing sulfur to improve thermal embrittlement in electrodeposited nickel using citric acid A. Watanabe, Y. Takigawa Results in Surfaces and Interfaces, 1, 1000001 (2020).（査読有り） doi: 10.1016/j.rsurfi.2020.100001 This paper was selected as a Highlighted Article and featured on the journal page. Better and more attractive nickel plating: A technique that removes sulphur from the nickel plating process maintains ductility at higher temperatures and enhances visual appeal

A paper was published on Sci. Rep. Microstructural heterogeneity in the electrodeposited Ni: insights from growth modes I. Matsui, A. Watanabe, Y. Takigawa, N. Omura, T. Yamamoto Sci. Rep., 10, 5548 (2020). doi: 10.1038/s41598-020-62565-z Microstructural heterogeneity in the electrodeposited Ni: insights from growth modes - Scientific Reports

A paper was published on MTLA Mechanical properties and microstructures after abnormal grain growth in electrodeposited Ni–W alloys I. Matsui, A. Watanabe, T. Uesugi, N. Omura, Y. Takigawa , T. Yamamoto Materialia, 8, 100481 (2019). doi: 10.1016/j.mtla.2019.100481
